definition:
#### Definition

A function $f \in L^2({\ensuremath{\mathbb R}})$ is called *progressive*
iff its Fourier transform is supported by positive frequencies only:
$${\ensuremath{\mathop{\rm supp}}}\hat{f} \subseteq {\ensuremath{\mathbb R}}_+.$$
It is called *regressive* iff the time reversed function $f(-t)$ is
progressive, or equivalently, if
$${\ensuremath{\mathop{\rm supp}}}\hat{f} \subseteq {\ensuremath{\mathbb R}}_-.$$
